channel.title: Lecture Notes on MIT OpenCourseWare
channel.description: Recent content in Lecture Notes on MIT OpenCourseWare

item.title: Lecture 1: Types, Variables, Operators
item.description: Lecture presentation on programming in Java. Topics include: the computer, CPU instructions, programming languages, Java, program structure, output, types, variables, and operators.

item.title: Lecture 2: More types, Methods, Conditionals
item.description: Lecture presentation on programming in Java. Topics include: types, variables, operators, division, order of operation, methods, parameters, return values, mathematical functions, and conditionals.

item.title: Lecture 3: Loops, Arrays
item.description: Lecture presentation on programming in Java. Topics include: good programming style, frequent issues, loops, and arrays.

item.title: Lecture 4: Classes and Objects
item.description: Lecture presentation on programming in Java. Topics include: object oriented programming, defining classes, using classes, constructors, methods, accessing fields, primitives versus references, references versus values, and static types and methods.

item.title: Lecture 5: Access Control, Class Scope, Packages, Java API
item.description: Lecture presentation on programming in Java. Topics include: access control, class scope, packages, and the Java API.

item.title: Lecture 6: Design, Debugging, Interfaces
item.description: Lecture presentation on programming in Java. Topics include: good program design, consistency, naming, good class design, debugging, psuedocode, design, testing, intervals, tools, assertions, methods, objects, and Java interfaces.

item.title: Lecture 7: Review, Exceptions, IO
item.description: Lecture presentation on programming in Java. Topics include: interfaces, sprites, inheritance, exceptions, and file input and output.

item.title: Lecture Notes
item.description: Abbreviations API = Application Programming Interface I/O = input/output LECÂ # TOPICS FILES 1 Types, variables, operators (PDF) 2 More types, methods, conditionals (PDF) 3 Loops and arrays (PDF) 4 Objects and classes (PDF) 5 Access control, class scope, packages, Java API (PDF) 6 Design, debugging, interfaces (PDF) 7 Inheritance, exceptions, file I/O (PDF)
